org.apache.hadoop.io
Interface Writable

All Known Subinterfaces:
InputSplit, WritableComparable<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractMapWritable, ArrayWritable, BlockLocation, BooleanWritable, BytesWritable, ByteWritable, ClusterStatus, CompositeInputSplit, CompressedWritable, Configuration, ContentSummary, Counters, Counters.Counter, Counters.Group, DBInputFormat.DBInputSplit, DBInputFormat.NullDBWritable, DocumentAndOp, DocumentID, DoubleWritable, FileChecksum, FileSplit, FileStatus, FloatWritable, FsPermission, GenericWritable, ID, IntermediateForm, IntWritable, JobConf, JobID, JobProfile, JobQueueInfo, JobStatus, LineDocTextAndOp, LongWritable, MapWritable, MD5Hash, MD5MD5CRC32FileChecksum, MultiFileSplit, MultiFileWordCount.WordOffset, NullWritable, ObjectWritable, PermissionStatus, Record, RecordTypeInfo, SequenceFile.Metadata, Shard, SleepJob.EmptySplit, SortedMapWritable, TaggedMapOutput, TaskAttemptID, TaskCompletionEvent, TaskID, TaskReport, Text, TupleWritable, TwoDArrayWritable, UnixUserGroupInformation, UserGroupInformation, UTF8, VersionedWritable, VIntWritable, VLongWritable
public interface Writable

A serializable object which implements a simple, efficient, serialization protocol, based on DataInput and DataOutput.

Any key or value type in the Hadoop Map-Reduce framework implements this interface.

Implementations typically implement a static read(DataInput) method which constructs a new instance, calls readFields(DataInput) and returns the instance.

Example:

     public class MyWritable implements Writable {
       // Some data     
       private int counter;
       private long timestamp;
       
       public void write(DataOutput out) throws IOException {
         out.writeInt(counter);
         out.writeLong(timestamp);
       }
       
       public void readFields(DataInput in) throws IOException {
         counter = in.readInt();
         timestamp = in.readLong();
       }
       
       public static MyWritable read(DataInput in) throws IOException {
         MyWritable w = new MyWritable();
         w.readFields(in);
         return w;
       }
     }

Deserialize the fields of this object from in.
